<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 117, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 170, 905, 187]]<|/det|>
0625/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 232]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 247, 505, 264]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 337, 227, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 354, 880, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 565, 570, 613]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[268, 847, 728, 864]]<|/det|>
This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

massweight
Agreater than on the Earthsame as on the Earth

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
In a famous experiment, a scientist showed that, when water in an insulated tub is stirred, its temperature increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 497, 135]]<|/det|>
What can be concluded from this experiment?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 134, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 144, 430, 163]]<|/det|>
Temperature is a store of energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 170, 134, 189]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 170, 541, 189]]<|/det|>
The water absorbs heat from the surroundings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 197, 134, 215]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 197, 680, 215]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 223, 134, 241]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 223, 359, 241]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 800, 803, 817]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 665, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 129, 608, 147]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 156, 133, 175]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 155, 621, 175]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 183, 131, 201]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 183, 613, 201]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 210, 598, 227]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 757, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 235, 876, 255]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 266, 764, 286]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 295, 134, 314]]<|/det|>
